text:
4. Technology. As noted previously, improvements in technology increase productivity
and potential GDP. More rapid improvements in technology lead to greater rates of
economic growth.
Natural resources. Raw material inputs, such as oil and land, are necessary to
produce economic output. These resources may be renewable (e.g., forests) or nonrenewable (e.g., coal). Countries with large amounts of productive natural resources
can achieve greater rates of economic growth.
